page.title: 13A VILLAGER IN GT. GADDESDEN
page.content: Mrs Pryor's HOMELIFE revolves around Gt Gaddesden where she has lived for 65 yrs.She belongs to a very large familly and owns 5 acres of land.In the VILLAGE some Elizabethan houses have been pulled down but in 1933 Mrs Pryor prevented some cottages from being destroyed & renovated them.The P.O. has closed.The remaining shop is the farm shop.There are some CLUBS in the village: Youth Club,Toddlers, Aerobics, Over-60's & W.I. Mrs Pryor did help in the CHURCH in the Mother's Union & she arranged flowers.The congregation is not large & there are no activities connected with the church.A chapel was built in 1964 in memory of a relative of Mrs Pryor's, a clock was installed.
